81C037084A2C456AB4386A569F6647B6.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

179343B22E0F43DAA4EB80FF4DDD0B23.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

6DC33E755B1146C3B20733B45AC91E39.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

A273F1AA28A442F9A89F6B1D2BC2F356.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

5F0C1105A2CC4658869215445AC778A4.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

F997C5EE5A4B45D9B692EBA2C58AF0A7.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

12FD60A7C77342DCAB6BBDEF55CF0201.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

CE868B1861D3451787676E3DC4500DF3.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

3798B4C4806E4668A4962D3AE1E73404.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

9B8B59DDFD414A748FC88010CB0E0096.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

4CB8447D2C0D40A792215D17C6FDF580.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

EA262F79010343E0A54BBBA2DBA8C48F.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

26B889B746FF4DCAAA171197CFC235C7.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

7B8CCB5238504F8B96FF576EF7B08F3B.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow? Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?.

76F405993F904F78AB68DB1FB9288B85.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

903367122299433D8D3DB8B48F72AA68.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

29AE5B6CDDBF4F4B81FA975FAB4CE47C.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

9EFC2DB501FD42DFB9EEA5EE38B483B5.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

D0034068D0EE403891C498A7C821E106.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

2A28818527304C9E8AADFAFB8F0BB801.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

DF214D1D6C6D4F57B38AA7D67012842A.description: Communicate research findings related to electrical and electronics-related occupations through a display, brochure, video, presentation software, website or an oral presentation.

891FF66234624209840DA8AAF0FDDC98.description: Research experience and qualifications for newcomers to enter the electrical and electronics industry.

0CB81F7E9E684C9D9BFD4CCC728E497C.description: Explore opportunities for underrepresented populations in the electrical and electronics industry.

1C15D21D7E1D4EC9BE836367587B32F8.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific electrical or electronics-related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational and training requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; work environment, including typical hours and shifts work and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; apprenticeship and/or certification requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan; and, future trends impacting the trade.

C8E2051CB76C4E609F7464F32B5209D7.description: Examine the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in electrical and electronics-related occupations.

1A4737AE125649D284B66BB16636E308.description: Research which electrical and electronics-related occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally or provincially.

54CE4F88851343ECAFA484A4E6C6375A.description: Investigate occupations in the electrical (e.g., electrician, electrical engineering technologist, industrial electrician, telecommunications line and cable technicians) and electronics (e.g., electronic systems engineering technologist, electronics service technician and electronics assembler) trades.

5EDDED4CD7CA42BF94BEFD58BF510693.description: Create a list of personal interests, skills and traits that may lead to a career in the electrical and electronics industries.

0BC6BB4A9584447593FE1FA3FCD579A7.description: Demonstrate increasing proficiency in electrical and electronic-related techniques, work skills and presentation skills.

A25B269D71FF44259DE6C2AB4BDC0EA5.description: Assemble and present a project utilizing skills in planning and management as outlined in Module 37 Introductory Project.

8CFC5EF320C948EEA692C67855BF9604.description: Construct an intermediate level assigned or approved electrical or electronics project.

777F45AD2CA44AEA90B21162509BB075.description: Create new products using recycled electronic equipment and components.

CB92DE8604C248BFA2D7832F316D85C6.description: Identify equipment and components suitable for reuse in other projects.

ECB52C9EAA7447A8A9B9ECFC93C1410C.description: Test the functionality of equipment and components intended for reuse and/or recycling.

4181F3022F4D4C2CB519D9F834AA8AD5.description: Outline the end-of-life journey of electronic equipment, including the role and environmental impacts of recycling programs.

F1884C3135E649758415D4D6F891B086.description: Discuss the environmental and economic impact of the demand for improved consumer electronics.

2BF1FF25B5724A9C90985A0BDC7117E7.description: Research the environmental and economic impact of mining raw materials for electronic products.

4FCCF5C486A442128CD3FD0EB22C4FC9.description: Investigate the environmental and economic impact of manufacturing and recycling electronic equipment.

0BF6A47D76424618A8B2CB168219AC72.description: Build and verify the operation of a logic gate circuit.

D58D759C23AB48FB97B7A708CA932664.description: Design a logic gate circuit and verify the design by constructing a truth table.

DE22B244EC114142BD9E368C190F2223.description: Apply Demorgan’s theorem to Boolean expressions and logic gate circuits.

8D986DC97B7545A488FBA60BD98470B3.description: Convert a Boolean expression to a logic gate circuit and a logic gate circuit to a Boolean expression.

19338A6791424A7FAF590E92F4736376.description: Write Boolean expressions using the operators AND, OR and NEGATION.

8244DA9F320F4C959152B841138D4C9C.description: Write a single truth table for a multi-input device.

4A688EDAA4C240749EAD8FD2B0712AC5.description: Draw logic symbols and truth tables for the following logic gates: AND, OR, inverter, negation, NAND, NOR, exclusive-OR and exclusive NOR.

41AD89A553AD46E5B3F03CD1D184B33E.description: Describe the purpose of a logic gate in digital circuits.

8AE1584AEF5847BDB414D50413A39D4D.description: Explore how the concept of binary logic applies to digital circuits.

6BBF5BB3E8AF4643B3FA88F5D961FC2E.description: Explore the role of binary logic in digital circuits.

0134DF5BEB8E4D38AB233E000B8E2BCE.description: Justify a selected power supply for use in a specific electronic application.

7B0C44C1D5F74ACCB6304C1EFABF450C.description: Examine the suitability of alternating current (AC) and direct current (DC) power supplies for electronic applications.

6A22FCE6FFD148A187163D960AF2DC0B.description: Compare different power supplies in terms of voltage, current, reliability and functionality.

142C7537D8AE413491F1C81B71BE89E4.description: Interpret datasheets to determine specifications (e.g., current, voltage, line regulation, load regulation, ripple and noise), features and applications of specific power supplies.

7CD36C9C9E7A4007839B330B1B8CA03B.description: Describe the advantages and disadvantages of different types (e.g., wall outlet, battery, solar and alternative) of power supplies for electronic applications.

4914AC0AFB4249A3BDDA929DDE7E9C6F.description: Identify power supplies suitable for electronic applications.

4B83BBF466874DED86157BB55D8E7186.description: Assess the suitability of power supplies for electronic applications.

325FD6B8598A4B2D85DF154073F09D06.description: Execute proper techniques to de-solder electronic components.

02BD0BF195FB427A87FB6AFF304BDE56.description: Identify the proper technique for equipment selected to de-solder electronic components.

3908F4110EDE49F3B41F7C695A636555.description: Select appropriate equipment (e.g., PCB holder, soldering gun and soldering iron) to de-solder components.

E5D0F885FE734C238F0B37B65F3C9632.description: Identify the purposes (e.g., repair, replace, recycle and troubleshoot) of de-soldering.

87A6E6CF8C744D94B029DA27F3EC0049.description: Demonstrate safe practices when using de-soldering tools.

45398560D1014A2A81C83C625F1FDE45.description: Assess the quality of soldered connections.

5E765D0AC6044710AFDFB0BE0225A4D0.description: Create soldered connections on printed circuit boards.

D0127A02034C4CE4995B25143EFEBDC3.description: Identify the types (e.g., hook splice, T-splice and Western Union splice) of soldering connections used in soldering.

D56125C4B47A4E05BBE2BF70397E7418.description: Determine the appropriate composition of solder based on the intended use.

2CF4AEA9B5B74B328E4C46448E3047CC.description: Identify different solder compositions including lead-based and lead-free.

05AE6D24F2B4494FB00AB9E80DB3492F.description: Describe the function of flux in the soldering process.

3E377902D96D44E2822BD717EF95B0A5.description: List the advantages and disadvantages of using a soldering iron or soldering gun in the soldering application.

D052CD4B372046B3BE10832BC2D46849.description: Identify the various parts of a solder station.

11114DC6957D4EE892A907E106368349.description: Demonstrate safe practices when using soldering tools.

3CC8440254A341A3A6CE8B688FA1838A.description: Investigate how to control a microcontroller.

7D2A6F6C1949406DAA5C19E04795E353.description: Explore how a microcontroller controls inputs and outputs.

BEF0DDFF5064460798CE878534CEE59F.description: Discuss the need for software to control microcontroller operations.

BC9BA2B0BBD441A388DC32E871BC8CF0.description: Describe the function and operation of microcontroller components (e.g., microprocessor, memory and input/output pins).

249DF8A9E3E14E7E845D987B3F7C4F9F.description: Explore the purpose and operation of microcontrollers in electronics.

A13F55CAB4D2470FBEB36FB3EE620534.description: Construct and test circuits containing one or more ICs.

C02CB07ACA164C06B9E0FB367AC8E631.description: Determine the specific purpose, function, operation and potential applications of given ICs.

4CB1AE65F384491A86B696A39F01C541.description: Create pinout diagrams for IC packages.

273F2BC60B9944E68D9B2B3C7F43FBDA.description: Compare the advantages and disadvantages of different methods (e.g., single in-line, dual in-line and surface mount technology) of mounting IC packages.

E833DC3E49954F018128A5AB7D85DB86.description: Provide examples of applications of ICs in electronic circuits.

3E481E142F544BF69A82D18E673666D4.description: Research the development and evolution of ICs.

5C70F277489D4F68826C6C847CE20B87.description: Demonstrate safe practices when using ICs.

2D3298120F9F4F8DB9D5EE0CA223C72C.description: Explore the role of integrated circuits (ICs) in electronic circuits.

B74D7794F8F34386A68D22E7C4FFC869.description: Draw and label schematic symbols of generic NPN and PNP transistors.

50D6E50DC9E749EA9F5F122AB1F9402D.description: Draw and label pictorial diagrams of negative-positive-negative (NPN) and positive-negative-positive (PNP) transistors.

FB91879C42AD4B5C80B04CC2F5E860FA.description: Identify the possible materials needed to create a transistor.

D84CB7A138284B1FB09DD94527FD96C7.description: Differentiate between bi-polar junction transistors (BJTs) and field effect transistors (FETs).

D669427ABC264216888A59E729F72CA0.description: Draw schematic symbols for various types of transistors.

6BF4FA2722364903BC9951D957E32630.description: Provide examples of applications of transistors in electronic circuits.

FA129524481B45498DE23F2FDBB1AC15.description: Describe the purpose and operation of transistors.

1724937631B4487CBC425CF79E378BCE.description: Explain how the development of transistors revolutionized the field of electronics.

27692E5330EA4A1885CFE2DECF41F165.description: Explore the purpose and operation of transistors in electronic circuits.

BAF124A42D0B47389EF3BA87F87468C7.description: Explain how diodes with different properties can be used to perform different functions.

6BBCA471B6FD4EA1AC6D22E4D6A2A686.description: Draw the schematic symbols for various diodes such as zener diodes, varactor diodes and LEDs.

CE78F4A705774497AF07969AAE13DF49.description: Interpret meter readings of diodes to check the labeling of the leads.

F2B0D363B9994E528429E47C1428749C.description: Test different shaped diodes to determine their anode and cathode.

C4F620AD4DC84721A91CCFF56D039ED1.description: Explain, with the aid of a diagram, the effect of applying different polarities on a junction.

96C88E295B724EA1A7A1EAF8EF820C1D.description: Explain what happens when n-type and p-type material form a junction.

FD017A2ACD0F4E0E86B314BA02C53CBB.description: Draw diagrams of silicon or germanium material doped with arsenic, phosphorus, bismuth and antimony to produce negative (n-type) material.

B47D67A422E2463B8B1044EEA99705EC.description: Draw diagrams of silicon or germanium material doped with indium, gallium and boron to produce positive (p-type) material

4D67375D99FB472B94AAB76132253FD5.description: Describe the effect on the power factor when capacitors are added to a circuit.

17500095859E40FC82DAA33DD9A2E86E.description: Explain phase shift and power factor as they relate to capacitors in electronic circuits.

365F5AFC7B2F456693CAFB96987294E3.description: Determine the power used in a capacitive circuit.

F1AFC59DC17045E39F9EAABCFE7F4715.description: Determine equivalent capacitance in both series and parallel circuits.

CEBE6FBF3B3740FD81F86676D71AC04C.description: Connect capacitors in series and parallel circuits.

1E8A4408B3274D7EA47EC36DC1F8390B.description: Discuss how to combine capacitors in series and/or parallel to create specific capacitance values.

6939679F91C740619B09EEA119BF602C.description: Investigate uses of capacitors in electronic circuits.

CA73B34B00E64C288286C130937FD2BD.description: Determine resistor wattage size required for specific applications.

16A940EE1A614F99A0B09CFD17886680.description: Compare measured resistance values to calculated equivalent resistance totals in series, parallel and combination circuits.

00A69AD8B655422DB78DAB9F798A917C.description: Compare measured resistance values to stated resistor ratings.

0DFD10B8C1164A729AE0DD9E9023BC05.description: Measure resistor values using a digital multimeter.

17F1C2192353424EBC6B93D3C5D7AFFB.description: Discuss how to combine resistors in series and/or parallel to create specific resistance values.

6E70444BC35B423DB562AC2F33F47521.description: Measure characteristics (e.g., peak, peak to peak and root mean square) of a sine wave using an oscilloscope.

144C7BCB3E994E4D84F4A6DF3DF3325B.description: Create sine, square and sawtooth wave patterns using a function generator.

8B8CB2E94A9F489981099C38F6E3D3F4.description: Measure values such as pulse width, duty cycle, rise time, fall time, amplitude, average value, pulse recurrence time and pulse recurrence frequency in a digital circuit using an oscilloscope.

331E956CDF884542BBFC396DE7966630.description: Measure the phase shift across a capacitor in a resistor-capacitor circuit using an oscilloscope.

1C2CAF7C0A3A4834AA5727A6ABCFE2DF.description: Measure the voltage of alternating and direct current sources using an oscilloscope.

980D44894F0645D1BA2E6DE0AE053866.description: Explain the function of an oscilloscope’s controls.

68F65338F97E413BBF5802BD7F5817DA.description: Troubleshoot to determine why transformers are not working.

BD60D0FA7DE14668837A5D4D7D3EF11C.description: Experiment with different types of transformers to determine how they might be used.

A9A75C3922DC415E84A48B702C8F8F5E.description: Explain transformer impedance matching to determine transformer use.

58AF079D1A7E423C8BEC4FE1AF5B8357.description: Determine the efficiency of specific transformers given the appropriate load, current, resistance and power losses.

C4775DE424D2483D9634DE7872F23AE1.description: Connect a load to a transformer.

0674337D265349BD8F8450D76ADAAF51.description: Describe common uses of transformers in electronic circuits.

07781AA0B3B34A6EBDFB3445A1CDAABF.description: Demonstrate safe practices when working with transformers.

C7AE21DA33BC49B6A38DE89877BDDF16.description: Explore the use of transformers in electronic applications.

590F95985EDC4588A11CF75A06109196.description: Draw a schematic diagram for a circuit containing combination circuits.

46A1A6BF17384B2FBB099EF1A998C0AD.description: Draw a schematic diagram for a circuit containing no more than five components.

E732FF2AF2FC45E3A52E33293A65F350.description: Construct an electronic circuit using a schematic diagram as a guide.

E66B00F25519413C9FE0906E5B0492D4.description: Interpret schematic diagrams of electronic circuits.

5E9B159638C34CD4B4D651D32634D1B4.description: Identify common symbols used in schematic diagrams for electronic circuits.

219A86F7ED7E465AA40E2385C26E059D.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of representing electronic circuits using schematic diagrams.

CCDB18505C994820A0408269E5CE3056.description: Examine the role of schematic diagrams for designing, constructing and troubleshooting electrical and electronic circuits.

669D1EC8E20F40828E3A675DA4AD3D02.description: Inspect tools before use, and in consultation with the instructor, tag out for repair as required.

1DBBED4CCFF64AAF9754B29A73025D9E.description: Classify tools according to their capabilities (e.g., cutting, striking and holding) and method of power (e.g., hand, power and electric).

EBBCEB518F1B47269DEC5AA49BF341CA.description: Select and use appropriate hand and power tools.

C7393CBAFDAB4480AD70A76868E10EB8.description: Describe safety precautions including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) required for each tool used.

A858F01CBB36414F817E61321FB5DDE3.description: Identify and follow safe work practices associated with hand and power tools.

D3F58BF1C7D445479D89646C7F1CD1EF.description: Identify and use hand and power tools safely and appropriately.

26E07BDC08314A98896F282C25764EEA.description: Identify risks and potential safety hazards (e.g., tools on floor, exposed live wires and extension cords).

DE4B66741B094A9BADC5FD15EC53E7AF.description: Describe the importance of a clean work area and methods used to maintain a clean work area.

2B9A286898014E85B2159C31E2C071D3.description: Identify hazardous materials and relevant WHMIS procedures.

4B31F16D9FE844A394DAB4968471AAA7.description: Explain the purpose of ventilation in a confined environment.

E0BD64B3167D416DB27B196DD435AD0D.description: Discuss appropriate actions in case of an injury or accident, such as whom to contact and first-aid procedures.

C258AC1BAA3142E18890F1B12EE7F779.description: Describe ways to reduce personal injury or material and equipment damage as a result of unsafe work acts or environments.

260AC4D66F834C8FBAFC09827A7731DA.description: Review the fire evacuation plan for the work area including the location of fire alarms, fire extinguishers and exits.

6E29CCAE61F942D2869426356CB5E39D.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety goggles, footwear, hearing protection, headwear and protective clothing.

154648EDC3244C5CA3E582E7FC2BA791.description: Recognize and apply safe and fair work practices including freedom from violence, harassment and bullying.

FA29EEB7E801449EAFBB5DC1095D134F.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in the work area.
